bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 115 (Wednesday, July 13, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BACON:H.R. 8348.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Seciton VIII, Clause 14: ``Congress shall havethe power to . . . makr rules for the government andregulation of the land and naval forces . . .''[Page H6335]

Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.title: United States NATO Force Deployment Policy Act of 2022

item.title: United States NATO Force Deployment Policy Act of 2022
United States NATO Force Deployment Policy Act of 2022
To provide it is the policy of the United States that the NATO-Russia Founding Act, signed May 27, 1997, in Paris, does not constrain the deployment of United States or NATO forces in any way.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Europe, Energy, the Environment and Cyber.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
